result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel S Michalski

records.addlTxt: 3:06 PM  Defendant Daniel S Michalski not in court.  Attorney Crystal A Vera in court for Daniel S Michalski.  Attorney Will Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. Warrant to remain outstanding.

Per Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS) violation report, Court orders bench warrant issued. 
If the Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCPS. If the Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCPS is required to enforce conditions of release and the Defendant shall report to DCPS by 10:00 a.m. on the business day following release from jail. All other bail conditions remain set.
DCPS Violation Report; Court Response: issue $500 bench warrant; bail hearing previously scheduled to be cancelled
DCPS Violation Report; Court Response: set for bail hearing at same time preliminary hearing
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

02:12 PM Defendant appeared.  Defendant's attorney contacted the court and asked for a preliminary hearing.Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
DCPS Violation Report; Court Response: no change, continue to monitor. Defendant advised further violations may result in warrant

10:13 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Crystal A Vera.  ADA Lexi Keyes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court colloquy with Defendant regarding Pretrial Services Violation Report. Statement by ADA Keyes. Statement by Attorney Vera. Statement by Defendant. All conditions remain the same. Warrant shall be quashed today.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

to Quash Bench Warrant

New charges declined per DA, bail hearing to be cancelled
DCPS Violation Report; Court Response: set for bail hearing at same time as IA on new charges; if no new charges filed, hearing can be cancelled
Per stipulation granted by Comm Asmus, clerk contacted DCSO to withdraw warrant.
Status conference on July 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Per Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS) violation report, Court orders bench warrant issued. 
If the Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCPS. If the Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCPS is required to enforce conditions of release and the Defendant shall report to DCPS by 10:00 a.m. on the business day following release from jail. All other bail conditions remain set.
DCPS Violation Report; Court Response: Issue warrant with $500 bond amount.
Status conference on July 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant indicated positive test was a result of cough medicine.  State asked court to admonish defendant of requirement to complete tests as ordered.  Court orders defendant to continue bail as ordered.

02:05 PM Defendant appeared.  Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daniel S Michalski appeared by video means.  Defendant has Crystal Vera in other case.  Defendant to contact SPD to have her appointed on this case.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
DCPS Violation Report; Court Response: to be addressed at bail hearing already set for 5-9-2022

Bail/bond hearing on May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:51 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Erin Nagy.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is ill and defense counsel request a set-over.  Crystal Vera will be appointed.  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
DCPS Violation Report; Court Response: set for bail hearing at same time as status conference, further violations may result in warrant
Defn appeared in person on 21CF282. Atty Crystal Vera unable to appear due to COVID 19 Protocol; atty not appointed on 22CF570. Defn sent to SPD to apply for attorney on 22CF570.
DCPS Violation Report; Court Response: continue to monitor, future violations may result in bench warrant
DCPS Informational Report
Zoom
Status conference on May 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not be at McDonald's in on W North St in Deforest. 
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2

02:29 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Luis C Cuevas.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
